page.title: 02Bearley continued
page.content: clusted around the church and manor house, parts of which date back to the fifteenth century. Many of the people living in these houses have been in Bearley for a long time, others are professional or business people. Further down the village on the site of the RAF camp are the council houses built in 1956. Many of original camp squatters still live in these houses and a number of nationalities are represented among them, Latvians, Poles and Italians. These original families are supplemented by families moved out from Stratford Upon Avon and there is much poverty and unemployment. Between these two halves of the village is a new development of exclusive executive houses whichalmost form a separate village. Bearly is criss crossed by several old roads including a saltway and a number
